channel.title: Projections relatives à la COVID-19 à Ottawa on Ottawa COVID19
channel.description: Recent content in Projections relatives à la COVID-19 à Ottawa on Ottawa COVID19

item.title: Methods
item.description: Described below is a brief description of methods, data and model parameters used at 613covid.ca. More detailed information can be found in the accompanying references. Projection models All data used to create projection models can be accessed at Open Ottawa. See ’COVID-19 cases and deaths`. Data used to create wastewater projection models can be accessed at PHESD. COVID-19 short-term projections are created using the Bayesian EpiNow2 model developed by the EpiForecasts team.

Utilisation des modèles Les projections s’utilisent principalement de deux manières : Les projections à court terme (2 à 4 semaines) servent à connaître les besoins immédiats en services hospitaliers et en soins critiques pour les patients atteints de la COVID-19. Les projections à long terme (6 semaines ou plus) servent à évaluer l’effet d’un relâchement de la distanciation physique. Précision des modèles Il est difficile de faire des projections précises à long terme sur la propagation de la COVID-19.

item.title: Changelog
item.description: V3.6.0 2022-02-24 Hospital projections added to homepage. V3.5.0 2022-01-28 Wastewater projections and growth estimates added to Wastewater page. V3.4.0 2021-06-16 Updates to the Wastewater page. Variant plot updated to include a midpoint rolling average. Details on variants of interest/concern detection included in page. V3.3.3 2021-04-08 Plot added to the Wastewater page visualizing proportion of variant B.1.1.7 RNA detected in wastewater.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact média : Dr. Robert Delatolla robert.delatolla@uottawa.ca Problèmes du site web ou avec les données? Dr. Lakshmi Pisharody (mailto:lpisharo@uottawa.ca) Remerciements pour le site Web et le contenu: Dr. Douglas Manuel, Warsame Yusuf, Rostyslav Vyuha, Yulric Sequeira, Gauri Saran, Mathew Thomson et les autres membres de l’équipe de Big Life Lab. Avec le soutien des épidémiologistes de Santé publique Ottawa: Amira Ali, Jacqueline Willmore, Dara Spatz Groupe de recherche uOttawa – CHEO SARS-CoV-2: Robert Delatolla, Alex MacKenzie, Patrick D’Aoust, Élisabeth Mercier, Antoine Cantin, Tyson Graber.

item.title: Ottawa COVID-19 wastewater surveillance
item.description: 613COVID Website Update Ottawa wastewater surveillance continues with daily testing and analysis performed in the lab of Dr. Robert Delatolla, Professor, Department of Civil Engineering, University of Ottawa, who has led that work since its inception in April 2020. The lab, led by Dr. Delatolla, has expanded its focus beyond SARS-CoV-2 to include influenza and RSV viruses, with the data being regularly reported on the official website.

item.title: Ottawa COVID-19 wastewater surveillance
item.description: Wastewater plots last updated: 29 November, 2024, 15:04:50 Wastewater samples collected up to: 02 June, 2020 Reported date up to: 29 November, 2024 The website is updated Monday to Friday at approximately 5 p.m. Updates can be delayed if measurements do not pass quality assurance and quality control checks. Samples that are collected from Monday to Thursday are processed the day after collection. The website and plots are updated the day after processing.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: The main purpose of this site is to visualize Ottawa-based projections for models performed by other teams. Review and update model parameters based on recent published studies. Priories for review: ventilated patients deaths
